title.narrative: Enhancing Entrepreneurship and Business Growth in Kosovo

description.narrative: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) are the direct beneficiaries of the project, with special focus on marginalized groups. They will benefit from project activities in strengthening their organizational and management capacities that brings to a more efficient business performance and higher business growth and in return leads to more jobs being created. Through project activities, the beneficiaries will improve their entrepreneurial, managerial and business skills, and speed access to local and regional markets through Business Support Services (virtual services - small market analysis, finding a partner, pre-sales services etc). These businesses will be provided with loans through the business plan competition and all of the enterprises will have the opportunity to be exposed to investors with the purpose to obtain investments funds. As a result of the business support services, growing programs and the financial support provided, the Micro and SMEs will be able to spur innovation, create jobs and build thriving economies.

Project outcomes: 1. Strengthening existing start-ups and MSMEs for maximizing their contribution to the national economy by stimulating innovation and accelerating business growth through capacity building and business support services 3. Development of an entrepreneurial ecosystem of support. 4. New jobs created Outcome indicators: 1. 50 start-ups and MSMEs improved their entrepreneurial and managerial skills, and have speeded access to local and regional markets 25 (out of 15 by woman) Start-ups and MSMEs grown.(increase in sales, increase in exports, increase in number of employees) 2. 50 entrepreneurs has the necessary information for existing financial instruments in the Kosovo market. 3. 15new jobs created

The Partner shares the vision of the Program: The consortium partners are united in their vision that pro-poor sustainable economic growth, particularly through (1) strengthening relevant local partners, (2) facilitating entrepreneurship; and (3) creating an enabling environment for private sector development, is essential for creating self-reliance and thereby poverty alleviation in least developed countries and fragile states. The United Entrepreneurship Coalition and its partners works towards this vision efficiently and effectively;

mailing-address.narrative: CEED Street Bajram Kelmendi No. 34, 10000 Prisht 34 PRISTINA Kosovo (XK)
